{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Beta 1,3 Glucan test is used to detect invasive or disseminated fungal infections. According to Document [0], this test can aid in the detection of Aspergillus, Candida, and Pneumocystis jirovecii. However, it cannot be used to detect Mucor or Rhizopus, the fungi responsible for mucormycosis, as they do not produce (1,3)-beta-D-glucan.", "answer_choice": "C. Mucormycosis"}
